definition: to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)

sentences.english: I want to renew some books at the library.
sentences.chinese: 要到图书馆去续借几本书。

sentences.english: Sorry, your items are overdue and may not be renewed.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，您的书已经过期，不能续借。

sentences.english: But you must come and renew it.
I'd like to borrow a book on medicine and renew this one.
sentences.chinese: 我想借一本医学方面的书并续借这本书。

sentences.english: No, you can't renew any novels.
sentences.chinese: 不行，你不能续借任何小说。

sentences.english: Can I renew them by phone?
Hold on please, and I will process your application right now.
sentences.chinese: 请不要挂线，我现在为您办理续借手续。

sentences.english: I renewed the library's book for another month.
sentences.chinese: 我将图书馆的书续借一个月。

sentences.english: If you can't finish the book by then, you must come and renew it.
sentences.chinese: 这本书如果你到时候还看不完，就应当来续借。

sentences.english: You must do that at the end of the month.
After that you must renew the books if you wish to keep them longer.
sentences.chinese: 一个月之后如果你想借更久，你必须续借。

sentences.english: If you can't finish the book in time, you may renew it.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不能及时看完这本书，你可以续借。

sentences.english: And if I want to keep them longer can I renew them now?
sentences.chinese: 那么如果我想借得久一点，现在我可以续借吗？

sentences.english: Can I renew the books without bring them here?
sentences.chinese: 我没带书能办理续借吗？

sentences.english: I want to renew these books.

definition: to lend (sth other than money)/to borrow
to present (a bill of exchange etc) for payment
to be overdue/to fail to meet a deadline/to be behind in doing sth
to report the loss of something
a loan/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/to provide a loan (e.g. bank)/to raise a loan (from e.g. a bank)
to lend/to put out a loan
